agentPreferences.description: Process management with persistent tracking, log capture, and lifecycle control. Run commands, spawn background processes, monitor output.

run.description: Run commands and wait for completion

runCommand.description: Run a command and get output
steps: Use run_process for commands that complete (builds, tests)
Output is automatically cleaned and compacted

startDevServer.description: Start and monitor a development server
steps: Use spawn_process to start the server
Use wait_for_pattern to wait for 'listening' or 'ready'
Use get_logs to check output periodically

tips: Use run_process for commands that finish (builds, tests)
Use spawn_process for long-running processes (dev servers, watchers)
Use wait_for_pattern to know when a server is ready

agentPreferences.description: Git history operations for understanding code evolution. Blame, history, commits, and diffs.

blame.description: Understand who wrote code and why

understandCode.description: Understand why code was written a certain way
steps: Use blame_file to see who wrote each line
Check commit messages for context
Use file_history to see evolution
Use recent_changes to see what changed
Use diff_file to compare versions
Use search_commits to find related changes

tips: Use blame_file to understand intent behind code
Use search_commits to find when features were added

agentPreferences.description: Project metadata operations. Quickly understand project structure, configs, scripts, and dependencies. Auto-detects project root from subdirectories.

steps: Use get_project_info for overview (type, version, workspaces)
Use get_scripts to see available commands
Use find_configs to locate configuration

tips: Start with get_project_info when entering a new codebase
Works from any subdirectory - auto-detects project root

agentPreferences.description: Symbol-aware code operations for AI agents. Read and edit code by function/class name instead of line numbers. Auto-indexes on startup and watches for changes. Supports TypeScript, JavaScript, Python, Go, and Rust.

steps: Use list_symbols to get overview of a file
Use read_symbol to read specific functions/classes
Use search_symbols to find symbols across files

editSymbol.description: Edit a specific function or class
steps: Use list_symbols to find the symbol's name path
Use read_symbol to see current implementation
Use edit_symbol to replace the entire body
Use get_imports to see what a file imports
Use get_exports to see what a file exports
Use analyze_deps to detect circular dependencies
Use get_callers to find who calls a function
Use get_callees to see what a function calls

refactorAcrossFiles.description: Rename or refactor symbols across the codebase
steps: Use find_references to see all usages
Use rename_symbol with dry_run=true to preview changes
Use rename_symbol to apply the rename

tips: Auto-indexes on startup - no manual index_project needed
Use list_symbols with depth=0 for just top-level symbols
Use get_callers/get_callees to understand impact before refactoring
Use analyze_deps to find circular dependencies
Use rename_symbol's dry_run=true to preview changes
